"S-S-Storm! R-R-R-Rogue! That t-t-t-t-t-tickles!" Kitty giggled as the duo cleaned her tummy up, despite Kitty's writhing and wriggling . Soon, Shadowcat's large belly was cleaned up and she was on her feet again. "So, what should we do next?" she asked the duo. Rogue and Storm looked at each other thoughtfully.

"I mean, we can eat... watch TV... relax in the pool... or maybe... go to the mall and get some new clothes and then hit the buffet for dinner?" Kitty offered with a grin. Storm and Rogue didn't say anything as they considered Kitty's offers, especially about the buffet. They had greatly enjoyed their meal there yesterday as well and were looking forward to their next visit. But still, yesterday had been their cheat day and the food was slightly fattening in calories.

Kitty, meanwhile, was hoping they would chose her idea of going to the mall and then the buffet. Like the older X-Ladies, she had greatly enjoyed her feast there yesterday and was hoping to go back again, hoping the duo would agree to take the discount offered by their waiter the night before.

Kitty then realized she was drooling slightly at the thought of the buffet's wonderful and delicious food and quickly wiped her mouth with her arm. Luckily, Rogue and Storm were too busy discussing Kitty's offer to notice their teammate's embarrassment at the moment.

Finally, the duo ultimately decided to...
11522211131134233.title: Instead, what happened to Rogue?

choices: The X-Girls are satisfied until dinnertime. They then pig out again at said meal
11522211132.content:
The Adversary was watching Earth with his magical powers. He was a demon who, years earlier, had been summoned to said planet by the shamanic technopathic mutant Forge after his company was slain during Vietnam. However, Forge had then came to his senses and banished the Adversary, though not before Adversary managed to get a foothold to said planet.

Years later, he was summoned again, this time by Forge's mentor Naze after the latter was killed by an alien parasite called a Dire Wraith, only for him to be defeated by Forge again, this time with help from Forge's new friend Storm. After that, he managed to escape again and fought with the X-Men and Freedom Force in Dallas, Texas. But that had also resulted in his recent defeat.

Now, he was planning to spread chaos in the human world. Using his powers to search the globe for the key figures who could stop his plan, he finally found them. Three female members of the X-Men: Rogue, a southern belle with the ability to absorb a person's personality, skills, powers, memories and so on via skin contact. Storm, who could fly and manipulate the weather, hence her name. And the youngest member, Kitty Pryde, alias Shadowcat, a computer genius who could phase through solid objects, including people.

The trio didn't know they were being watched by the team's enemy. They were too busy talking and laughing after a day of training. Kitty was goofing around with her powers by phasing through the furniture in the room with the trio as Storm and Rogue both laughed in amusement. In his current dimension, Adversary smirked at the trio's unknowingness as what was going to happen to them. Using his powers, he began to use his powers to effect the trio.

At Xavier's the three X-Ladies were still talking and hanging out when Rogue heard something in her head. "Rogue, you shouldn't starve yourself. You're skinny like a twig and should fill out more." the voice told her.

Then, Kitty heard something in her brain. It sounded like a little voice in the back of her own head. "Shadowcat, you are so skinny for a teenager your age. You're a growing girl and surely would like to eat more food. You should start eating more fattening foods and extra helpings at meals." it told her. Kitty seemed to dwell on the idea after the voice vanished and it looked like Rogue was giving the same thoughts to the 'advice' from her own little voice.

Ororo was next. "Storm, as leader of the X-Men, you shouldn't be letting yourself or your two friends go hungry. Take my advice and start eating more and more every day. Starting right now." Her tiny voice told her.

As the three girls stayed in silence, thinking about what their 'voices' had ordered, Adversary smirked evilly as he watched. After a moment, he heard the low rumbling of Kitty's thin tummy. The 14-year-old blushed and put a hand on her skinny twig belly.

"I dunno about you guys but I'm starving." Kitty told Rogue and Ororo. "But we have already had lunch, Kitten. Besides, it is only four more hours until dinnertime." Ororo said. Then, her own tummy gurgled and rumbled in protest. "But all the same, I too admit I am feeling rather peck-ish." she admitted as Kitty giggled. Rogue's belly followed suit a second later.

"Eu tu, Rogue?" Kitty asked innocently. "Yeah. Me too, sugah." Rogue admitted with a sheepish smile and blush. Without another word, the trio headed for the kitchen to grab some snacks to tie them over, all while being watched by Adversary, who just smirked evilly as he watched his victims doing so.

Upon reaching the kitchen, Ororo grabbed a large tub of vanilla ice cream and started filling a giant bowl with it. Rogue, meanwhile, grabbed a large bottle of soda and a huge bag of potato chips while Kitty simply phased through the cabinet and grabbed a whole package of cookies, which she started to inhale like crazy as Rogue shoveled handful after handful of potato chips into her mouth and Storm shoveled giant blobs of her ice cream into her gullet, dripping some on her costume and on the table in front of her.

After finishing those snacks, the X-Ladies kept eating. Kitty began eating a massive amount of candy while Rogue scarfed down more chips and Storm didn't stop eating the ice cream until she had licked the carton clean. Their bellies, while somewhat full, still seemed empty and so the trio kept eating until an hour later when they had finished the 3rd large snack beige in a row.
11522211132.title: Wishing for Revenge

choices: That night, they have a giant midnight snack
115222111321.content:
After the 3rd snack beige, Kitty, Rogue and Ororo all leaned back in their chairs. Empty ice cream cartons, potato chip bags, candy wrappers, soda bottles and cookie packaging littered the table. "Man, we really were hungry." Kitty remarked as she patted her full tummy in delight. She didn't want to admit it, but she had really enjoyed pigging out like that on her favorite foods.

"I must admit that was very delicious." Storm smiled as she rubbed her own stuffed belly blissfully. "Ah think we'd better clean up our mess. At least we should be good until dinnertime." Rogue smirked as she began cleaning up her half of the mess, followed by Kitty and Ororo. As they worked, they still didn't notice Adversary watching them with an evil grin. "That's right, you little fools. Just keep listening to the 'advice' I planted in your heads and soon you'll be very fat and too pooped to fight me." He thought to himself.

After cleaning up the mess, Kitty, Rogue and Ororo went to their respective rooms to relax before dinner. Kitty decided to read a new Star Wars comic she'd bought while out shopping with Ororo yesterday while Ororo went to water her plants and Rogue simply sat on her bed and thought about her powers. Eventually, it was time for dinner.

Kitty, Rogue and Storm arrived after the others did. What they saw they couldn't believe. A massive feast stood before them. A giant roast turkey, large bowls of mashed potatoes, a huge basket of biscuits, corn, green beans and other foods stood before them.

"Uh... guys? Are you okay?" Rachel asked, eying the trio's glazed expressions. Hearing the question, the trio snapped out of their trance. "Uh, yeah Rach. We're fine." Kitty said as Ororo and Rogue both nodded in agreement. At this, their teammates and the New Mutants eyed each other but didn't say anything.

As soon as Kitty, Ororo and Rogue all sat down, however, it was like they were possessed by beasts. They loaded their plates to overflowing and began eating like savages. Kitty shoved an entire drumstick into her mouth and pulled a completely sucked clean bone out of her mouth a second later. She then did the same thing to the second drumstick a few minutes later.

Rogue shoved spoonful after spoonful of mashed potatoes into her mouth, bulging her cheeks before she swallowed loudly with a grin. Ororo, meanwhile, was viciously attacking the numerous cobs of corn on her plate. Bits of corn flew everywhere as she mowed through each cob loudly. Magneto, Rachel, Colossus, Wolverine, Nightcrawler and the New Mutants all watched in shock at their friends' lack of table manners as the trio kept pigging out on the food.

Kitty grabbed the biscuits and, after letting Rogue and Storm take a giant handful, poured the remaining ones into her mouth, bulging her cheeks as she swallowed with a gulp. Rogue, meanwhile, just grabbed the bowl of mashed potatoes and started eating from that while Storm, following Rogue's example, grabbed the green beans and Kitty took the stuffing and corn.

"Good thing we got our dinners before they sat down." remarked Illyana, Colossus' little sister and Kitty's best friend and roommate from beside Peter and Cannonball. "Yeah. They've never eaten like this before." remarked Cypher with concern as he eyed Kitty loudly chugging a big bowl of gravy, spilling it onto her uniform slightly.

Soon, *UUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!!!!!!!* Kitty, Rogue and Storm all belched loudly, their bellies noticeably chubbier. "Oh man. I think I ate too much." Kitty moaned, putting a hand on her potbelly.

"I concur, Kitten. My own stomach is rather upset from all that food as well." Storm confessed as she rubbed her own gut. "Mah belly ain't doin' much better either." Rogue agreed, her own potbelly rumbling in protest at the massive meal inside it.

"Maybe you three should go lay down." Nightcrawler advised. "You're right, 'Crawler. Maybe a good night's sleep can help us." Rogue agreed as she, Kitty and Ororo all stood up and headed for their rooms, leaving the others watching in concern.

Once in their rooms, the three girls didn't both getting changed into their pajamas. Instead, they simply flopped onto their beds and were out like a light as soon as their heads hit their pillows. All night, they dreamt of food and becoming fat.
115222111321.title: The X-Girls are satisfied until dinnertime. The...

choices: The X-Ladies pig out until nighttime
11522211133.content:
Andreas Morton was just your average man. He was six foot two, with black hair and brown eyes. He also had tanned skin. But he had one thing that made him different from other humans: he was a mutant.

His powers included increasing people's appetites and fattening them up however big he desired, plus some super strength and agility. This made him an Omega Level Mutant. Despite this, he'd never joined the X-Men or any other hero or villain team during his life. That was more or less just as well since he favored peace over conflict. That's why he made a plan: to fatten anybody who might be a key figure in any group that could threaten his plan.

This case, it happened to be one Ororo Monroe, alias Storm of the Uncanny X-Men, a team of fellow mutants who fought for human/mutant rights under Professor Charles Xavier, the world's most prime telepath, who Andreas set his sights on. As the X-Men's leader, Storm could fly and control the weather, hence her codename. Andreas knew that these powers might cause a hitch in his plans should he and the X-Men cross paths soon. But if he made Storm fat enough to be too pooped to fly or winded to use her weather powers, he likely wouldn't have an issue fighting them.

With this in mind, he began tracking Ororo's every movement outside the Xavier Institute. On this one day, she was accompanied by two fellow female teammates. One was Rogue, who had the ability to absorb people's personas, memories, abilities, etc. via skin contact, as well as super strength and flight, which she'd gained by using her powers on the Avenger known as Ms. Marvel.

The second was Kitty Pryde, alias Shadowcat, the baby of the main X-Men team. She had the ability to phase through solid objects, including people. She was also the team's computer genius.

Right now, the trio were talking and laughing as they carried their shopping bags, having evidently gone to the mall. Ororo was in the middle, Kitty on her left and Rogue on her right. All three of them seemed to be enjoying themselves immensely.

As he waited, Andreas smirked to himself as he eyed Ororo. She was fairly tall, with brown skin, blue eyes and white hair in a mohawk style. She was also dressed in black leather clothes and boots. Aside from the mohawk, she was fairly pretty.

"But still," he told himself mentally as he waited for the trio to come closer to where he was hiding. "she still poses a threat to my plans. But, if I make her big and plump, she'll be too out of shape to help her friends stop me." At that thought, Andreas chuckled to himself as he imagined the obese Ororo trying and failing to stop him, first by flying, only to belly flop onto the ground, then by trying to fight him physically and with her powers, only to become too winded and pooped out to do so.

With this thought and image in his head, Andreas aimed his hands carefully at Ororo. As she started to pass, he fired a yellow beam at her, hitting her very lightly in the back. However, he was so excited, he accidently fired two more.

One hit Kitty in her butt and the other hit Rogue in the back of her neck. Both girls shuddered slightly but merely thought they'd suddenly had a quick shudder on their spines. Andreas, though unsure of how his plans were going to go down now with Kitty and Rogue also likely going to be affected, merely shrugged and slipped away unseen and unheard into the alley's shadows.

As the three X-Ladies kept walking back home, unaware of what'd happened, Ororo's stomach suddenly rumbled rather loudly. She froze in surprise as she gently touched her trim and lean tummy in shock.

Rogue and Kitty turned to look at her. "Sugah, are ya alright?" Rogue asked in her usual southern accent. Ororo was quiet for a moment, and then she nodded her head.

"Y-Yes, Rogue. I am quite alright. I must need something to eat is all." Storm smiled assuredly. Then, Kitty's own tummy rumbled loudly, causing the 14-year-old Jewish mutant to blush. "Guess you're not the only one, 'Roro." She said sheepishly.

Then, Rogue's own belly grumbled hungerly, causing the southern belle mutant to blush as well. "Ah guess Ah'm kinda hungry mahself." she agreed. "We might as well try to find something to eat before going home." Storm decided as the trio looked around hopefully. As she did, Kitty noticed a new restaurant not too far away. "Hey, I think I found one!" she called, pointing to it.

"'The Bellybusting Family Styled Restaurant. Mutants welcome'." Ororo read aloud thoughtfully. It seemed like a good place to grab a bite to eat. And she, Kitty and Rogue were starving, as evidenced by their rumbly tummies. With that, Ororo led the duo into the the restaurant for their lunch, unaware that Andreas was watching with an evil smile.
11522211133.title: Dawn of World Peace

choices: The trio, full to bursting, return home. Next morning they have a big breakfast
115222111331.content:
Upon entering the restaurant, Kitty, Storm and Rogue felt like they'd died and gone to heaven. Yummy smells filled the air as waiters and waitresses carried delicious looking meals to their diners, causing the trio's bellies to rumble even more. After a moment, a young man came up to them. He was roughly around Rogue's age, with sandy brown hair and dark eyes.

"Hello and welcome to the Bellybusting Family Styled Restaurant. I'm Jack Powell, owner and manager. Would you follow me please?" He smiled as he led the three X-Ladies to a scanning machine. "What's this for?" Kitty asked in bewilderment.

"It's to help us determine if you're mutants or not. If you are, it entitles you to our 'Anything on the menu free' deal." Jack explained. "Alright." said Ororo as she, along with Rogue and Kitty, bravely walked into it and allowed the green light to scan them, their tummies rumbling in protest at having to wait even more for food. After a few minutes, the machine brought up their powers and codenames on a large screen. Upon seeing these, Jack's eyes widened in shock and awe.

"Y-You three are X-Men?!?!? I'm honored to have you in my restaurant! I've been following your adventures for the last three years! You guys are my heroes!" He exclaimed in delight as he shook each of their hands. "Well, thank you. We appreciate any support we can get." Storm smiled. "Yeah, yeah. Enough talk, let's eat!" Kitty said, her belly rumbling in agreement. At that, Ororo lightly bopped the youngest X-Man on the back of her head. "Kitten, that was very rude." Storm scolded.

"Sorry, 'Roro. But Ah think the gal's got a point. Mah belly's rumblin' up a storm and Kitty's ain't much better." Rogue admitted with a slight smile. Jack simply smiled at the trio. "It's alright, Miss. Monroe, I understand your friend's eagerness." he told her as he led them to a big booth. It was so large, you probably could have put the entire X-Men team into it and still have some room for a few of the New Mutants.

"Now, remember, whatever you order is on the house whenever you come in here." Jack smiled as he handed them menus. The trio took a few minutes to read through their options, but all of them looked or sounded so yummy, it was hard to decide.

"I'll have whatever that great smell is." Kitty said. "Oh that's our bacon and cheese hamburgers. There's also our Yankee pot roast with chestnut stuffing, our deep fried chicken with our secret BBQ sauce, along with our honey glazed ham and... apple cinnamon pie!" Jack smiled. At that, Kitty Rogue and even Ororo's tongues flopped out of their mouths and almost onto the table.

Quickly recovering, Ororo spoke first. "That sounds delightful! Give us two orders of everything!" she requested as Kitty and Rogue also nodded in delight. "Ah. I love people who love to eat." smiled Jack as he went to place the order while the three X-Ladies excitedly tied napkins around their necks and eagerly awaited their massive feast.

Soon, the food had arrived and the three mutants were going to town on it like a pack of wolves. Within minutes, they had the attention of every costumer and employee in the restaurant as their plates and bowls began stacking up and their bellies began expanding. Kitty poured a whole basket of buttermilk biscuits into her mouth while Rogue devoured an entire honey glazed ham on her own and Ororo loudly inhaled a triple cheeseburger with bacon, lettuce, tomato and pickles. Kitty then shoveled a very big amount of fries into her mouth, causing some of them to poke out of her mouth, though that didn't discourage her. She simply crammed them completely into her full mouth by using her hand to smoosh them in before swallowing and chomping down on a normal hamburger with ketchup and mustard.

As the shocked diners kept watching, Jack came out, carrying even more food for the three X-Ladies, this time including a large deep fried butterball turkey. Upon him setting it down and them noticing it, Kitty, Rogue and Ororo all began tearing into it like crazy, sending bits of the turkey and crumbs flying. "I've never seen anything like this!" Jack remarked, actually sounding impressed. "But are you at least tasting the food?" He asked curiously as he eyed the three bloated yet still ravenous X-Girls.

Kitty, Rogue and Ororo, their cheeks bulging with a giant amount of food in them, food stains on their faces, all nodded. Then, loudly gulping her giant mouthful down, Kitty answered. "It's the best food we've ever had. Right guys?" she replied as Rogue also loudly swallowed her big mouthful. "Yeah. Delicious sugah." she told Jack as she licked her chin, cheeks and nose clean of the food stains on them.

Then, Ororo noticed a big bowel of gumbo. Without a second thought, she grabbed the bowl and, neglecting the ladle or an smaller, empty bowl next to it, started guzzling and slurping up the gumbo, getting some of it onto her face and clothes. After draining the bowl, she set it down and noticed a young woman around her age watching in disbelief. Ororo simply smiled at the girl, gumbo dribbling down her chin and on her teeth.

That made the poor woman burp in disgust and quickly leave after leaving the money for her meal while clutching her mouth. Just as she left, Magneto, Wolverine, Nightcrawler, Colossus and Phoenix, Kitty, Storm and Rogue's teammates, came in. When the trio didn't return from their shopping trip, the five got worried and decided to look for their friends. Upon hearing the trio's chomping, slurping and overall sloppy eating, they went over to the booth to find Shadowcat, Rogue and Storm still pigging out.

"So, how's the food?" Nightcrawler asked with a slightly raised eyebrow. Kitty wiped her mouth with the back of her hand after eating some pot roast before answering. "Pretty darn yummy." She smiled. "Is there even anything left in the kitchen?" Rachel asked in amusement. At that moment, Jack walked past. "I'll be right back, ladies. I just need to go to the market." He told them.

"It is getting rather late, Ororo. Might I suggest you three wrap this up and get home?" Magneto told them after this. Ororo, Kitty and Rogue all looked at each other in slight dismay. Sure, they were starting to feel full, but they still had 10 more courses and dessert. "We'd love to, Mags. But, we ain't had dessert yet." Rogue explained as Kitty and Ororo nodded in agreement.

"Alright. But come straight home after that." Magneto ordered as he and the others left. "No problem, Magneto. If there's a crime in progress before then, ya know where to find us." Kitty smiled as she and the others waved goodbye, Kitty holding a large drumstick. Once their friends had gone, Rogue tried to chomp on Kitty's drumstick, only for Kitty to quickly pull it away.

"HEY!" she protested, only for Ororo to tear a large chunk of it off due to Kitty forgetting about her. "Sorry Kitten. Could not resist." Ororo smiled sheepishly as Kitty playfully glared at her mother figure teammate as Rogue just laughed in amusement.
115222111331.title: The X-Ladies pig out until nighttime

choices: The X-Ladies hit the mall for new, larger clothes and then hit a buffet.
1152221113311.content:
A few hours later, the trio slowly staggered from the restaurant after polishing off a big chunk of their desserts. The trio's bellies were very round and hung over the waistbands of their pants.

"Thanks *burp* for everything, Jack." Kitty sighed with a burp. "It was great. Especially those last 16 pies." she added as she briefly poked her head back inside. "Glad you liked them." smiled Jack as Kitty then exited again, leaving the staff to deal with the massive piles of plates, bowls, trays, glasses and other items on the trio's table to clean up.

"Man, that was really good eatin'. Right, guys?" Kitty remarked to the equally bloated Rogue and Storm. "Ya got that right, sugar." Rogue smiled back. Then, *UUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRPPPPP!!!* She burped loudly. "Excuse me!" she blushed with a giggle. Ororo rolled her eyes at her younger friends' antics, though she was smiling as well.

"Y'know, it's kinda funny that we ate so much since we usually try to stay thin." Kitty pointed out as she poked her belly as they staggered back to the mansion. "I agree with you, Kitten. It does seem rather funny. Maybe we should let ourselves go a little since it brings us pleasure." Ororo remarked thoughtfully as she scratched her big brown boulder of a gut.

Unknown to the girls, Andreas was watching them as they headed for the mansion. He was very excited upon seeing the trio's bloated bellies as well as their delight at their new gluttony. Especially Storm. He could just picture facing the X-Men once the trio had ballooned to at least 400 pounds.

He was facing the X-Men at the mansion, trouncing each of them with ease. Then, came a 410 pound Storm, flying towards him... only to belly flop in front of him, wheezing and sweating heavily as she struggled to get up. Then, a 400 pound Shadowcat came waddling towards him and tried to throw a punch, only for him to easily sidestep her weak hook and then push her onto her back, causing poor Kitty to end up like a turtle stuck on its' back, her fat arms and legs waving pleadingly. Then a 406 pound Rogue lumbered in, only to meet the same defeat as her friends due to her massive blubber. Andreas smiled evilly at this image as he used his powers so that the three ladies would feel ravenous the next day.

By now, the trio had reached the mansion. "Man, if we keep eating like this, we're gonna be pooped before we even leave the buffet or wherever we pig out at." Kitty wheezed slightly as she, Storm and Rogue all caught their breath inside the main hall.

"Ah think... you're right, Kitty. Ah'm so... pooped..." Rogue wheezed in agreement as she leaned against the doorframe. "A good... night's... sleep... shall... do us... good." Storm panted in equal fatigue as the trio lumbered upstairs. Once in their respective rooms, the three girls all flopped onto their beds and were out like lights upon touching the pillows.

The next morning, Kitty woke up, feeling ravenous. Her still somewhat large belly rumbled and gurgled hungerly. "Need breakfast." She remarked as she got up and headed downstairs. Rogue and Storm were already downstairs waiting for her.

The trio came in to find a massive breakfast for them. Kitty's side had pancakes, doughnuts, eclairs, biscuits, bacon and sausages. Rogue's had pancakes, waffles, eggs, bacon, toast and sausages while Ororo's had doughnuts, pancakes, eclairs, biscuits, bacon and eggs.

"Wow. The others musta known we were starvin'!" Rogue remarked as she, Kitty and Storm all licked their lips hungerly. "I don't care where it came from... I just want it IN MY BELLY!" Kitty declared, running up and starting to scarf down her massive pile of food. Rogue and Ororo looked at each other, shrugged and then joined in.

Kitty then, using two forks, managed to shove an entire stack of pancakes into her mouth at once, smearing maple syrup and butter on her face. "Kitten, are you sure you can swallow that much? You may choke." Ororo remarked in concern. Kitty, cheeks bulging like a chipmunk's, didn't answer at first. Then, with a massive gulp, she swallowed the whole stack with no problem.

"Yeah. I think I can." She smiled as she then began forking piles of bacon into her mouth at top speed. Rogue, meanwhile, was using her hands to stuff her scrambled eggs into her gullet nonstop. She just gulped them down loudly and kept stuffing.

Ororo rolled her eyes at her friends' lack of manners, but then began doing the same thing with her own mountain of food a second later, causing Kitty and Rogue to smirk in amusement.

Soon, the trio had licked their plates and things clean. "That was a really yummy breakfast." Kitty sighed in delight as she rubbed her bloated tummy. "Ah'm with ya, Sugah. That really was good." Rogue agreed with a slight burp as she drummed on her own gut. Ororo simply smiled and then, *BBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBBUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRPPP!!!* Let out a massive burp, causing her to blush and the other two to giggle in amusement. "Guess Kitty and Ah ain't the only ones lackin' manners this mornin'." Rogue smirked playfully as Storm blushed even more.
1152221113311.title: The trio, full to bursting, return home. Next m...

choices: The X-Ladies eat most of the food and a massive ice cream sundae (free meals)
11522211133111.content:
After breakfast, the trio went upstairs to try on their new clothes. However, they ran into a problem with them. Ororo went through all six of her new t-shirts, discovering none of them even came close to covering her orb of a belly. Finally, she tugged on a stretchy t-shirt she occasionally used during workouts. She then tried her new leather pants, only to discover the same problem. They either stopped halfway up her big meaty thighs or refused to button and zip if she did successfully pull them all the way up, as well as feeling extremely tight in her privates. Giving up, she tugged on some stretchy sweatpants.

In her and Illyana's room, Kitty was having the same problem. Her new shirts barely covered her bellybutton and her pants were extremely tight on her butt, thighs and lower body as a whole. Like Storm, the 14-year-old finally gave up and tugged on a stretchy old t-shirt and spare pajama pants.

Rogue had the worse of it. Due to her powers, she couldn't touch people without absorbing their memories, powers and so on. Right now, her clothes were too tight on her hippo body. Sighing, she too pulled out some sweatpants and a sweater.

The trio met in the living room. "I can't believe it. We just went shopping yesterday and now we need new clothes again!" Kitty remarked, poking her belly.

"I agree with Kitten. We must've overindulged last night and this morning." Storm remarked as she eyed her own boulder sized middle in dismay.

"What're we gonna do?" Rogue asked as she pinched her belly fat. Kitty and Storm were quiet for a moment and then Kitty had an idea.

"I think I got a solution. Yesterday I happened to see this new store. It's called Big Plump Girls and it looks like a clothing store for big, meaty girls like us." She explained eagerly. Storm and Rogue were quiet and then Storm nodded thoughtfully.

"We might as well look there. I highly doubt our normal stores will have plus sizes for us." She remarked as Rogue nodded in silent agreement. Soon, the trio arrived at the mall and found Big, Plump Girls. Like Kitty said, it was a clothing store and there were quiet a few heavyset females shopping there.

Storm felt awkward shopping at a plus sized store. She was always so healthy and fit but now, she had put on a large amount of weight in just several hours and had no choice but to shop here. The weather witch was also shocked by some of their fellow shoppers' sizes. In fact, one girl had to be around Kitty's age and yet was as big, if not somewhat bigger than Shadowcat.

At that moment, a chunky employee came up to the trio. "Hi and welcome to Big Plump Girls. I'm Gloria Steinman. May I help you ladies?" She smiled.

The trio quickly explained their personal interests in clothes and Gloria led them to each section one by one. Soon, the girls were inside the fitting rooms, trying on their new clothes, taking turns showing each other their choices.

Soon, Kitty, Storm and Rogue were leaving Big Plump Girls, each holding several shopping bags and wearing some of their new plus sized clothes. Despite themselves, each of them had greatly enjoyed their trip to the plus sized store.

"That was awesome. They have really cool things there." Kitty smiled as she peeked at some of the plus sized pants, t-shirts, bras, panties and even a few x-tra large dresses and bikinis she'd bought. She currently wore a big red t-shirt that read "I'm A Big, Fatty Girl and Proud Of It." and navy blue jeans sized XXL.

"Against my better judgement, I must agree with you, Kitty. That store truly does have some... interesting bargains for young women of our sizes." Storm agreed with a slight smile as she eyed her own massive clothes. They were much like her current leather clothes/costume, though considerably larger so she could fit them. She'd also bought bras, panties, dresses, bikinis and more normal clothes as well.

"An' they really seemed nice, even after they learned Ah can't touch people without absorbin' 'em." Rogue agreed, wearing a large version of her own clothes as well, having also bought the same clothes as her two friends and teammates.

As they climbed into Ororo's car after putting their bags in the trunk, Kitty's large tummy rumbled loudly. "Uh oh. Someone wants food." She told the others, rubbing her doughy belly sheepishly.

*GURGLE* *RUUUMMMMMBBBBLLLLEEE* *GGGLLOOOORRRRPPPP* Went Ororo's big brown gut as it too longed for food. "You are not the only one." She blushed as Rogue's own belly let out an equally longing rumble for food as well.

Storm soon pulled into the parking lot of an restaurant a few minutes later and the trio climbed out and went inside, unaware that Andreas was still watching them from his own car farther in the parking lot.

"That's right, Storm. Keep eating and fattening up. Soon, you and your two friends will be too fat and pooped to try and stop my plans for world peace. Then, I'll do the same thing to every hero who poses a threat to me." He chuckled as the obese X-Ladies headed into the restaurant and were almost quickly seated in a large booth.
11522211133111.title: The X-Ladies hit the mall for new, larger cloth...

115222111331111.content:
Inside the restaurant, Kitty, Rogue and Storm were looking over their menus thoughtfully. Once again, everything looked so good to the overweight trio that they found it hard to decide. At that moment, their waitress arrived.

"Alright, are we ready to order?" she asked with a smile as she took out her notepad and pencil. "Everything looks so tasty, we can't decide!" Kitty apologized. "Just bring us three orders of everything." Ororo decided with a smile as she, Rogue and Kitty handed over their menus. The waitress nodded and went to place the order.

Soon, the girls were once again loudly and messily scarfing down food like crazy as the diners watched in disgust, surprise and/or delight. Kitty stuffed a large cheeseburger into her mouth, smearing mustard around her lips as she did upon noticing their fellow diners' reactions.

"'Onder why they're staring?" she remarked through her bulging cheeks. "I bon't bow." Rogue mumbled through her equally stuffed cheeks, some crumbs flying from her mouth. Ororo just smirked at her friends' antics as she munched loudly on a big pickle that'd come with her very big club sandwich.

"Man, it seems we're always trying to stay thin, but now, we're eating like the Blob and becoming plump, chunky girls!" Kitty giggled as she squirted whipped cream onto a massive hot dog. "Yeah." Rogue smiled as she picked up the whipped cream can and began shaking it.

Kitty then took a shark sized chomp out of her hot dog, smearing some whipped cream on her nose. "It's a good thing villains and other creeps don't care about lunch." she remarked as she ate. "You sure said it, sugar." Rogue smiled as she finally finished shaking up the whipped cream and aimed it for her own wiener, licking her lips eagerly.

"Um, Rogue, I wouldn't use the whipped cream right now if I-" Storm began, upon seeing the build up of whipped cream bulging out the can due to Rogue shaking it too much. But it was too late. Rogue gently pressed down on the nozzle and she went flying as whipped cream squirted over the table and seemingly herself only. "Woah. Guess Ah shook it too hard." She laughed as she sat up, her face coated in whipped cream. Then, she saw her friends. Kitty looked like she'd grown a beard and Storm's face was just completely covered in the stuff.

"Sorry guys." Rogue blushed as she sat down beside them again. "It's okay, Rogue. It's not like it's not edible." Kitty giggled as she licked her face off and then began licking Ororo's after her face was cleaned while Rogue did the same with her own face.

Soon, the trio had eaten almost every bit of food in the building. "Man, *URP* am I full." Kitty remarked as she rubbed her big belly in delight. Rogue smiled as she too rubbed and patted her massive gut in pleasure.

"Ah don't think Ah could eat another bite if mah life depended on it." She joked as Kitty giggled in amusement at the joke. Ororo just rolled her eyes and picked up the bill, only for her jaw to drop in shock and alarm. Kitty noticed this a second later.

"What's wrong, 'Roro?' she asked. Still keeping her mouth open, Storm merely handed over the bill as her face remained frozen in shock. Kitty took one look at the final count for the bill and she nearly passed out. The same happened with Rogue.

The trio's bill was very expensive and, due to their shopping sprees today and the day before, they had only half of said amount left. "What're we gonna do?" Kitty asked nervously.

Rogue had an idea. "Ah got it. When we were lookin' at our menus, Ah saw a thing that says if we eat the Mega-Super-Duper Ice cream sundae, we'll get our meal for free. We'll just order it and eat at least most of it." She offered eagerly.
115222111331111.title: The X-Ladies eat most of the food and a massive...

choices: Rogue whips up a junk food feast.
11522211134.content:
The X-Man known as Rogue was walking through New York City one summer afternoon wearing a t-shirt and jeans. Usually, due to her power of being able to absorb people's memories, personalities, skills, etc. via physical contact, she would refrain from wearing said former type of clothing since she was unable to control her powers. Due to her absorbing Ms. Marvel during a mission, she now had said Avenger's super strength, flight and durability in addition to her normal abilities.

But today, she decided it would be okay to take that chance since, due to the rather muggy day, few people were out in the heat. Coming from the South, Rogue wasn't too bothered by the blistering heat. She was just walking along with she swung her arm and it lightly brushed a guy walking next to her, also in a t-shirt so his arm was exposed to hers. He shuddered and crumpled to his knees but didn't seem too shaken up.

"Ah'm sorry. Ah guess Ah wasn't watchin' where Ah was goin'." Rogue apologized to him. The guy merely smiled and assured her it was okay before they went their different ways. However, as they walked away from each other, Rogue began feeling odd.

Unknown to her, the guy she had absorbed was what is called a "feedie/foodie", which meant someone who has a desire to make oneself and/or someone else bigger weight wise. As she headed home, deep within her subconsciousness, Rogue felt a desire she'd never felt before. She looked down at her very thin, trim and attractive body as this desire bubbled in her.

"Dang. Ah'm a skinny twig. Ah gotta get some meat on mah bones. Ta do that, Ah'm gonna need more junk food to mah diet. Like maybe I'll eat some ice cream when Ah get home. After that, there's bound ta be some more greasy, fattening and sugary goodies for me ta eat." she thought to herself as she kept walking for Xavier's, her stomach rumbling in anticipation of her new diet.

Luckily for Rogue, there was no one home at the mansion except for Ororo Monroe, alias "Storm", the X-Men's team leader who could fly and control the weather, hence her codename and Kitty Pryde, AKA "Shadowcat", the youngest of the current X-Men at 14 years old who could walk through soild objects, including people and use this power to also walk on the air. Kitty was also the team's computer genius. The other X-Men (Magneto, Phoenix, Nightcrawler, Wolverine and Colossus) had gone to Muir Island for a vacation, leaving the trio behind should there be a problem in New York. The New Mutants, meanwhile, had been allowed to visit their families for the next month as their own vacation.

Reaching the kitchen, Rogue grabbed a carton of chocolate ice cream and grabbed a large bowl. She sat down and began scooping five very massive scoops out of the large carton, humming to herself as she did. After closing the carton's lid and putting it back in the freezer, Rogue grabbed her spoon and began eating the ice cream at top speed. Once it was done, Rogue leaned back after dropping her spoon into the bowl, sighing in contentment. "That sure hit the spot! Wonder what Ah'll have for dinner tonight since Ah offered to do the cookin' while the others're gone?" Rogue thought to herself as she got up and rinsed her bowl and spoon before putting them back and heading to her room to think about what the trio would do for dinner.
11522211134.title: Accidental exposure

115222111341.content:
A little later, Rogue was in the kitchen, thinking about dinner. As she looked through the cookbook, an idea hit her. "Of course! Why didn't Ah think about that before?!?!? If Ah'm gonna put more junk food in mah diet, its' only fair Ah share it with them as well!" Rogue thought excitedly to herself as she set to work.

Soon, Kitty and Storm had finished up a Danger Room session. They were walking to the kitchen after getting dressed, talking about their session when a delightful smell reached their nostrils. It was a greasy, delicious smell they'd never really smelled at the mansion before. Upon smelling it, Kitty and Ororo's tummies rumbled with hunger.

"Whatever Rogue's cooking, it really smells yummy." Kitty smiled, licking her lips. "I agree, Kitten." Ororo smiled as she followed Kitty to the dining room. When they got there, they couldn't believe their eyes. Rogue had whipped up a massive feast consisting of hamburgers, french fries, pizzas and homemade pies for dessert.

"Hey guys! Y'all are just in time for dinner!" Rogue smiled at them as she came in. "It really looks great, Rogue!" Kitty smiled in delight as she sat down. Ororo, however, was hesitant. "Rogue... what is with all the junk food?" she asked. "Ah decided we need some meat on our bones." Rogue answered as she sat down and grabbed a burger for herself as Kitty eagerly gobbled hers down and went for a second.

Ororo watched for a moment, still torn. On one hand, she wanted to remain thin and wasn't sure of all these extra food, but on the other, it really did smell yummy. So, with a shrug, Ororo sat down and began eating as well. The hamburgers really were tasty and the fries were crispy and delicious.

Soon, the trio had eaten everything on the table. "Man, Rogue. That was really tasty." Kitty smiled as she rubbed her belly. "Yes, Rogue. It was quiet delicious." Storm agreed with a smile of her own. Rogue smiled at her two friends and teammates.

"You're welcome guys. Ah'll go ahead and clean up while you guys go ahead and start the movie." She smiled as the duo stood up and went to the rec room to do so.

After wishing the dishes, Rogue came in the rec room with a very big container of popcorn for them. Though Kitty and Storm had eaten quite a bit during dinner, they couldn't resist the popcorn and, along with Rogue devoured it by the end of the movie.

As they went to bed, Rogue smiled as she watched her friends. "This is gonna be fun to do. Ah can't wait to see how big we all get soon." She told herself as they went to bed. That night, the trio all dreamed of food as they slept soundly in their beds.
115222111341.title: Rogue whips up a junk food feast.

choices: Two weeks later, the X-Ladies face a 'weighty' problem.
1152221113411.content:
The next morning, Rogue was the first one up and cooking breakfast within minutes of waking up. By the time, Ororo and Kitty came downstairs, it was to find a massive breakfast for them. Stacks of pancakes drenched in syrup and butter, slabs of bacon sizzled to perfection, scrambled eggs and toast with butter and jam and a big pile of doughnuts.

"Rogue, I know you said you wanted us to put more meat on our bones, but I think this is overdoing it." Storm said with concern. "C'mon, 'Roro. Rogue went through a lotta trouble to whip this banquet up. The least we can do is eat as much as we can." Kitty protested as she eagerly popped a powered doughnut into her mouth whole.

Ororo was quiet for a moment and then nodded as she placed a few pancakes on her plate along with some eggs and bacon. Kitty, meanwhile, loaded her plate with the food as did Rogue. The trio had soon made quick work of the massive breakfast and were now leaning back in their chairs in delight.

"Oooohhh... that was delicious, Rogue. I love your cooking." Kitty smiled to Rogue as she patted her stuffed belly, before stifling a big burp behind her hand. "Once again, Rogue, I too agree with Kitten. Your cooking is very delicious." Ororo smiled to her friend. Rogue smiled at the two. "Thanks, guys. It's nice ta see that y'all appreciate some good ol' homemade cookin'." Rogue said as they stood up.

Though Kitty and Ororo both offered to help, Rogue insisted again that she do the dishes on her own. As she did, Rogue could barely contain her excitement. "This is great. At the rate we're goin', we're gonna be big bellied in at least two weeks! Still, Ah better help 'em pick up the pace if that's gonna happen." she thought to herself.

Later that afternoon after a big lunch, Kitty was reading a comic book on her bed while wearing a lime green t-shirt and blue jeans. As she finished the issue, there was a knock on her door. "Coming!" she called as she got up and went to the door. When she opened it, to her surprise, there was no one there. Instead, there was a big tray in front of her feet.

Confused, Kitty bent down and picked it up. She took it into her room and lifted the lid. There, on the tray, was a huge pile of freshly baked chocolate chip cookies. "Wow! Where'd this come from?" she wondered. Then, she noticed a note on the tray.

"'To Kitty. Just 'cause Ah know chocolate chip's your favorite cookie. Hope ya enjoy these. Love, Rogue'." she read aloud. "That was pretty cool of her." Kitty smiled as she picked a cookie up and took a bite.

She moaned in delight at the warm, gooey chocolate chips' taste and eagerly began scarfing the cookies down eagerly, starting to smear chocolate on her fingers and face.

Meanwhile, Ororo was finishing watering her plants with her powers when she heard a knock on her door. Confused, she went to the door, only to find no one there. Instead, she found a tray similar to the one Kitty'd gotten. Confused, Ororo picked it up and took it with her. Once back in her room, Ororo lifted the tray lid and found a freshly made apple pie. She found a note and read it. "'To Ororo. Hope y'all enjoy this apple pie Ah made. Ah know how much ya like it. Rogue'." Ororo read aloud with a smile. She picked up the fork Rogue had placed with the pie and eagerly began eating.
1152221113411.title: The next day

choices: Rogue comes back and makes a massive lunch. They snack for the rest of the day.
11522211134111.content:
Two weeks had passed after Rogue became a feeder/feedee. She would whip up massive meals for herself and the other two and they would eat it all. This, after two weeks, proved to have consequences.

"Oh boy." Kitty said one day as she stood on her bathroom scale. Not that she could completely see it, though. Her fattened middle pooched out enough that she had to lean slightly to see the scale's numbers. Originally, she'd been 110 pounds. But now, two weeks of massive junk food meals and snacks had ballooned her up to 220 pounds.

Now, in addition to her round belly, Kitty had a larger butt, chunkier thighs and hips, fat legs, arms, fingers, hands, toes and feet. Her face was also round and doughy, with a double chin forming. She was clad in pink panties and a pink bra as she checked her weight.

As she kept pinching and poking her bloated and plump body, Ororo came in. The weather witch had also grown considerably huskier. Originally a healthy 145 pounds, Ororo had since ballooned up to 230 pounds, making her ten pounds heavier than Kitty. Similar to Shadowcat, Ororo was also currently wearing only her bra and panties. Her big brown belly sagged over the waistband of her panties. Her arms, hands, fingers, feet, toes, hips, thighs, butt and face were all also puffed up.

"I'm starving. Where is Rogue?" she asked Kitty. "She went to the store, 'Roro. I think she said we're gonna have ham for dinner." Kitty explained as she stepped off the scale. "Ooh! Ham for dinner?!? Yay!" Ororo smiled, clapping her hands in delight like a little girl.

Kitty rolled her eyes as she brushed her bushy brown hair. "Y'know, Storm. For all your complaining about Rogue's unhealthy cooking lately, I can't help but notice you haven't missed a single meal like me." She pointed out with a smirk.

"Oh, you would love that, wouldn't you? Then you would have the whole ham for yourself." Ororo snorted. "Not that you need it." She added, eying her youngest teammate's gut. "Oh yeah? You're one to talk, porky." Kitty retorted, poking Ororo's own big belly.
"Who's the one who took Rogue's lasagna to her room so we wouldn't see her eat it?" She added.

"Well, who was the one who used four slices of cake to make a cake-witch?" Storm snarled back. "I was tryin' to cut back on carbs." Kitty replied as she returned to her and Illyana's bedroom. "That may be, but be honest, when was the last time you could even see your either of your feet completely?" Storm replied, following Kitty. "How about you? Your belly's bigger than mine." Kitty retorted.

"Alright, alright. I apologize, Kitten. I'm just ranting because I haven't eaten anything in... 7 minutes." Ororo apologized as she sat on Kitty's bed. "You want some of Rogue's fudge?" Kitty offered. "You have fudge?" Storm asked eagerly. Kitty smiled.

"Close your eyes." she smiled as Ororo did so. Kitty then reached into her underpants drawer and pulled out a napkin with large chunks of fudge wrapped in it. "Okay." she smiled as she brought it over. "Oh boy." Ororo smiled as she and Kitty both grabbed a big piece and bit into them.

"OOOOOOOOOOOOOhhhhhh!! So creamy and fudgy." Kitty moaned in delight, her mouth full. "Y'know what'd be great? Ham flavored fudge." She remarked to Ororo. "Or," Ororo said as she chewed her mouthful of fudge. "fudge covered ham." she remarked with a swallow, causing Kitty to moan in delight at the thought.
11522211134111.title: Two weeks later, the X-Ladies face a 'weigh...

11522211135.content:
How about this option:

Friendly(?) Competition: The three end up getting into a contest of eating and weight gain, that spirals into a belching and farting competition. Sound good?
11522211135.title: Something else…

choices: The trio tie. They turn it into a burping/farting contest.
115222111351.content:
One afternoon, Shadowcat, Rogue and Storm were hanging out at the mansion together. They were trying to think of something to do to pass the time. As they sat in the living room, Kitty's thin belly grumbled hungerly. This gave her an idea. "I wonder if..." She thought with a sly grin as she turned to Rogue and Storm.

"Hey, guys... I think I know something we can do for fun." she said slowly. Ororo and Rogue looked up upon hearing this. "What is it, Sugar?" Rogue asked, looking away from her magazine. "How about an eating contest?" Kitty offered. The two older X-Ladies eyed each other in surprise. "An... eating contest, Kitty?" Storm asked slowly. "Yeah. I bet I can eat more than either of you combined." Kitty smiled. At that, Rogue snorted in amusement. "Kitty, Ah don't know if ya forgot or not, but Ah come from the South. This little southern gal knows a thang or two 'bout eatin' contests." She smirked at her friend and teammate.

"Look, Rogue. I know you've got a high metabolism, but I'm no pushover with eating either. Remember, I'm 14 years old and we usually get increased appetites starting at that age." Kitty retorted. "Ah know, sugar. Ya make enough trips to the refrigerator durin' the day!" Rogue said. "Gimme a break, Rogue! Just because I graze a little doesn't mean I'm instantly a candidate for the Fat Farm!" Kitty fired back. Ororo sighed and moved between the two friends.

"Both of you need to stop it right now! You are both getting out of line." Storm said firmly. "Sorry, Storm. But Ah do think that eatin' contest's a good idea. It'll knock Kitty back a few pegs when Ah win it!" Rogue smirked. "Oh yeah?!?!? Well we'll see who's laughing when I win and you're busy barfing in a toilet!" Kitty fired back. Storm sighed in dismay as she eyed her younger female friends and teammates.

"You are both acting like little children. If you wish to do an eating contest, fine. But leave me out of it." she told them. At that, both Kitty and Rogue smirked at each other. "Gee, 'Roro... kinda sounds like ya don't think ya got what it takes ta beat us." Rogue said slyly. "Rogue's right, Ororo. You do sound like you're chicken." Kitty giggled. Ororo frowned indigently.

"I am not a chicken. I merely do not wish to take part in your silly squabbling." she fumed. "Bawk, bawk, bawk, ba-kaw!" Kitty clucked playfully, flapping her arms like a chicken. "Kitty's got a point, sugar. If you ain't a big chicken, then join us in the eatin' contest." Rogue smirked as Kitty kept clucking and flapping her arms. Storm was about to protest when Kitty began clucking even louder.

"BAWK! BAWK! BAWK! BAWK! BA-KAW! BA-KAW! BA-KAW! BAWK! BAWAK! BAWAK! BA-KAW!!! BA-KAW!" She clucked loudly with a naughty smirk at her friend and mother figure while Rogue laughed in amusement.

At that, Ororo couldn't take it for another minute. "ALL RIGHT!!!! I'LL JOIN YOU!!! JUST STOP ACCUSING ME OF BEING A CHICKEN RIGHT NOW!!!!!" She shouted, startling Kitty mid-cluck. Both younger X-Ladies smirked in victory.

"Now that we got that outta the way, should we have the eatin' contest here or at a restaurant?" Rogue asked. "We'd better have it here, Rogue. That way, we do not embarrass ourselves during it." Storm said promptly as Kitty nodded.

"Now, how 'bout food? Are we eatin' everything we have in the mansion or a certain kinda food?" questioned Rogue. "Let's go with junk food we can find." Kitty decided. "That sound good, Ororo?" The weather witch leader of the X-Men nodded.

"Let's do it!" Rogue shouted as the trio set off for the kitchen. Soon, the trio were sitting at the dining room table, a massive pile of food stacked in front of them. The other X-Men (Magneto, Colossus, Phoenix, Nightcrawler and Wolverine) and the New Mutants (Cannonball, Karma, Warlock, Sunspot, Magik, Cypher, Wolfsbane, Karma and Mirage) were all watching.

Ororo was going to handle the pies. Large Apple, peach, pumpkin, cherry, blueberry, strawberry, lemon, banana cream and chocolate cream pies were all stacked in front of her.

Rogue, meanwhile, was going to eat hot dogs and hamburgers. Regular sized burgers and triple decker ones towered in front of her. A stack of hot dogs slathered in ketchup, mustard and relish were beside them.

Kitty was covering doughnuts, cake and cookies. Five large cakes (chocolate, vanilla, red velvet, carrot and marble) were in front of her. So was a big tray of large-as-her-head doughnuts (chocolate, glazed, plain, powered and jelly filled) and an equally big tray of peanut butter, sugar, chocolate chip and snickerdoodle cookies, the cookies piled high in the air like the doughnuts.

"Alright, remember. Eat as much as ya can. No stuffin' the food into your clothes or any other kinda cheatin'." Rogue reminded the girls as they squared off. "You guys're goin' down!" Kitty vowed, licking her lips in hunger. "Was gonna say the same thang to you, Sugar." Rogue retorted with a smirk. "You are both 'going down'. I will eat the most of you two." Ororo vowed as she picked up her fork.

Magneto, who was the referee, looked at his stopwatch. "On your marks... get set... BEGIN!!!" He shouted. With loud yells, the trio immediately began inhaling their respective piles of food as the New Mutants and X-Men cheered their respective friend on.

Illyana, Doug, Rachel and Colossus were all cheering Kitty on, while Cannonball, Dani, Rahne and Nightcrawler cheered Rogue and the others cheered for Storm. Magneto and Logan, however, stayed neutral as they watched as well.
115222111351.title: yes!

choices: Storm joins the contest and beats them both.
Storm uses her powers to blow their farts back at them, knocking them out.
1152221113511.content:
By the end of things, all three girls were incredibly bloated and resting their big, aching stomachs on the table loaded with dishes. Their team was let down by the contest's outcome and had left them alone in the dining room to suffer. "Ooh...my poor gut", Kitty groaned, "what have I done to you?"

"This whole thing was a bust!" Rogue grumbled irritably. Storm said nothing but nodded her agreement.

"But we can't just let things end in a tie! We just need to find a way to relieve this pressure and have a rema-UUUUUUUUUUUUURP!"
Kitty's argument was cut short by her letting out a huge burp.

There was an awkward silent before Rogue smirked. "Here's your relief, Sugah! BUUUUUUUU-RRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRP!" This burp was much louder than Kitty's and shook the table.

Rogue shot a challenging look at the younger mutant, who returned it alongside a far louder burp: "BBBBBBBBBEEEEEEELLLLLLCH!"

Rogue was impressed. Storm was just annoyed. This annoyance increased as the southern belle changed things up and retaliated with a nasty fart. Kitty responded in kind and the whole dining room began to smell toxic. While they laughed, Storm's anger grew.
1152221113511.title: The trio tie. They turn it into a burping/farti...

choices: Suggests they go to a new unlimited All-U-Can Eat buffet place
Offers that they go to a fast food joint
11522211135111.content:
Ororo could barely hold back her anger. Kitty and Rogue's farting was seriously getting on her nerves as the two X-Ladies kept it up. At that moment, Kitty paused in her giggling to say something. "Hey, Rogue?" "Hmm?" Rogue asked. "Smell this one for size!" Kitty shouted and then let out a superb fart. *FFFFFFFFFFFFFRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPP!!!*

Rogue and Storm both coughed and choked in the stench. "Jeez, Kitty! What was in them cakes, doughnuts and cookies ya ate?!?!?" Rogue asked with a teasing smile. "Like you could do better?" Kitty challenged with a smirk.

"Alright, Sugah. Ya brought this on yourself." Rogue smirked as she began straining, her face turning red as she grunted. And then, *PPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPPOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOORRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT TTT!!* She let out another large fart, causing her and Kitty to laugh even more as they slapped and jiggled their big guts.

Finally, Storm couldn't take it for another minute. "ENOUGH! BOTH OF YOU! YOU ARE GETTING VERY ANNOYING RIGHT NOW AND ACTING LIKE IMMATURE CHILDREN!!!" She shouted. At that, both Kitty and Rogue looked at her in shock. "Jeez, 'Roro. We were just havin' fun." Rogue protested. "Yeah. Besides, you haven't gone yet. I'd like to hear what kinda fart you'd let loose." Kitty added with a smile. Ororo groaned at the request as she looked at the young girl with who she had a mother-daughter bond with.

"Kitty's right, Storm. You ain't let one rip yet an' Ah'm pretty interested in hearin' ya fart too." Rogue pointed out with a smirk. Ororo groaned in dismay again. "Alright. But this is absolutely the end of this ridiculous farting contest regardless of my farting." she ordered. "Okay." Kitty agreed. "Sure thang." Rogue smiled. Ororo took a deep breath and began grunting and straining.

Slowly, she felt the fart coming. Her belly gurgled from all the gas buildup. Kitty and Rogue watched as Ororo doubled over, clutching her massive tummy in agony. "Uh, Storm? Are you okay?" Shadowcat asked nervously. "Y-Yes, Kitty. I-I-I-I-I am... fine. I just feel... my fart... coming..." Storm began when she sat bolt upright and then, it happened.

*BBBBBBBBBBBBBLLLLLLLLLLLLLOOOOOOOOOOOOOORRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRCCCCCCCCCHHHHHHHHHH HHHHH!* Storm's giant fart triumphed over Kitty and Rogue's and filled the whole kitchen with the stench of everything that Ororo had eaten since the day before. Both Shadowcat and Rogue coughed and gagged at that stink bomb of a fart Storm had unleashed.

"Ya *cough* *hack* had ta encourage her, didn't ya?" Rogue huffed at Kitty as they kept coughing and gagging in the stink cloud. "I'm not the only one who did, Rogue! You also encouraged her!" retorted Shadowcat with a smirk.

"Ah guess you're the winner, 'Roro." Rogue said after a moment when Storm used her powers to blow the stench away. "Cool fart, Ororo." Kitty smiled from her chair. "Thank you, Kitten." Ororo beamed despite herself. "You know... and I can't believe it... but I'm still a little hungry." Kitty admitted. "Ah think it's because we burped an' farted most of our bloating away." Rogue suggested. "But we have nearly eaten everything in the mansion." Ororo pointed out, nodding to the plates piled in front of them.

"I have an idea." Kitty offered as she rubbed her gut with one hand and dug around in her ear with the other. "What is it, Kitten?" Ororo asked as she and Rogue turned to the youngest X-Man with interest.

Kitty...
